item.title: 中国卡车和食品制造商试图在油罐车丑闻后重获消费者信任
item.description: 周一，中国卡车制造商发布了食用油运输车辆安全标准，在有关油罐车运输食用油的报道再次引发人们对食品污染的担忧之后，这些公司试图重新赢得消费者的信任。【原文：China's truck manufacturers released safety standards for vehicles carrying edible oil on Monday, as firms attempt to regain consumer trust after a report about fuel tankers transporting cooking oil rekindled fears about food contamination.】

item.title: Alphabet 公布第二季度业绩增长两位数，人工智能应用、成本膨胀成焦点
item.description: 受人工智能云计算服务需求稳定和广告市场回暖的推动，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 预计将公布季度营收增长近 14%，连续第四个季度实现两位数增长。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet is expected to report a nearly 14% rise in quarterly revenue, its fourth straight quarter of double-digit growth, driven by steady demand for its artificial intelligence-powered cloud computing services and an uptick in the ad market.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，麦当劳将延长 5 美元超值套餐的使用期限
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引一份公司备忘录报道，汉堡连锁店麦当劳将在最初的四周窗口期后继续在其大部分美国餐厅提供 5 美元超值套餐。【原文：Burger chain McDonald's would continue to offer $5 value meal at most of its U.S. restaurants beyond the initial four-week window, Bloomberg News reported on Monday citing a company memo.】

item.title: 日本航空公司订购 10 架波音 787-9，并获得另外 10 架的选择权
item.description: 日本航空公司和波音公司周一在范堡罗航展的联合媒体吹风会上表示，日本航空公司已经订购了10架波音787-9飞机，并同意再订购10架。【原文：Japan Airlines has ordered 10 Boeing 787-9 aircraft and agreed options for 10 more, the two companies said at a joint media briefing at the Farnborough Airshow on Monday.】

item.title: 停电影响持续，CrowdStrike股价将扩大跌幅
item.description: 周一，CrowdStrike 的股价在盘前交易中下跌了 5%，延续了连跌走势，此前几位分析师下调了该公司的股票评级，原因是担心上周发生的全球网络中断事件会带来财务影响。【原文：Shares of CrowdStrike fell 5% in premarket trading on Monday, extending their streak of losses, after several analysts downgraded the stock on concerns over the financial fallout from the global cyber outage last week.】

item.title: 航空公司利润下滑和飞机延误给航展蒙上阴影
item.description: 瑞安航空季度利润的骤降给周一开幕的范堡罗航展蒙上了一层阴影，航空业的领导者们已经开始为供应链障碍、飞机延误和减排计划的搁浅而焦虑不安。【原文：A plunge in Ryanair's quarterly profits cast a shadow over the opening of the Farnborough Airshow on Monday, where aviation leaders were already fretting about supply chain snags, aircraft delays and floundering plans to cut emissions.】

item.title: 达美航空受网络故障影响，周一再取消600个航班
item.description: 达美航空公司周一取消了 600 多个航班，因为这家美国航空公司在上周的全球网络故障后仍在努力恢复运营，即使其他航空公司也在从这一事件中恢复过来。【原文：Delta Air Lines canceled more than 600 flights on Monday, as the U.S. air carrier continued to struggle to restore operations after last week's global cyber outage, even as other airlines were recovering from the incident.】

item.title: 特斯拉第二季度利润率可能下滑；机器人出租车和人工智能企业成为关注焦点
item.description: 特斯拉第二季度的利润率创下了五年多来的新低，这家电动汽车制造商可能会在周二发布报告，其首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）预计将加倍努力推进公司的机器人出租车计划和人工智能产品。【原文：Tesla's second-quarter margin hit a more than five-year low, the electric vehicle maker is likely to report on Tuesday, and its CEO Elon Musk is expected to double down on the company's robotaxi plans and AI products.】

item.title: 独家报道：信件显示，尤尼吉尔公司要求巴西国家石油公司赔偿巴西化肥厂的损失
item.description: 路透社看到的一封法律信函显示，巴西化工公司 Unigel 要求国营巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）赔偿两家租赁化肥厂的损失，这标志着重开化肥厂的谈判再次受挫。【原文：Brazilian chemical company Unigel is demanding compensation from state-run Petrobras for losses on two leased fertilizer plants, a legal letter seen by Reuters showed, marking another setback in negotiations to reopen the plants.】

item.title: Verizon 的定制计划使新增用户数量超过预期
item.description: Verizon 通信公司周一发布报告称，第二季度新增无线用户数量超过预期，这主要得益于对其灵活计划的强劲需求，这些计划还以折扣价提供流媒体服务，包括 Netflix 和 Disney+。【原文：Verizon Communications added more wireless subscribers than expected in the second quarter, it reported on Monday, boosted by strong demand for its flexible plans that also have streaming services, including Netflix and Disney+, at discounted prices.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯今年的经济增长因石油产量持续下降而受到影响
item.description: 路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，由于石油减产时间延长，沙特今年的经济增长速度可能是海湾合作委员会（GCC）国家中最慢的国家之一。【原文：Saudi Arabia's economic growth will likely be one of the slowest among the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) countries this year, according to a Reuters poll of economists who lowered growth forecasts from three months ago due to extended oil output cuts.】

item.title: 马斯克称，特斯拉明年将推出供内部使用的仿人机器人
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周一表示，特斯拉将于明年小批量生产仿人机器人，供公司内部使用。【原文：Tesla will have humanoid robots in low production for the company's internal use next year, CEO Elon Musk said on Monday, months after he announced that the rollout would be by the end of 2024.】

item.title: 运力过剩影响价格，加航下调 2024 年核心利润预期
item.description: 加航周一下调了全年核心利润预期，原因是某些市场的运力过剩影响了其定价能力。【原文：Air Canada cut its full-year core profit forecast on Monday, as over-capacity in certain markets impacted its pricing power.】

item.title: 地缘政治重挫市场步伐
item.description: 随着投资者面对欧洲日益分裂、美国孤立主义和世界贸易脉搏放缓的前景，政治因素已将全球市场从创纪录的高峰推翻，并在动荡的几周内凸显出来。【原文：Politics has toppled global markets from record peaks and over a turbulent few weeks stepped to the fore as investors confront the prospect of an increasingly fractious Europe, isolationist America and a slowdown in the pulse of world trade.】

item.title: 耶伦将在巴西举行的 G20 财金会议上就拜登退出竞选、特朗普等问题接受提问
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）本周将就美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）放弃连任竞选后美国的政策承诺面临二十国集团（G20）财政领导人的质询，而国际社会对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能重返白宫的忧虑也与日俱增。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen faces questions from G20 finance leaders this week over U.S. policy commitments after President Joe Biden dropped his re-election bid and as international angst grows about a potential return of Donald Trump to the White House.】

item.title: 美联储可能即将摆脱 "高企 "的通胀忧虑
item.description: 2021 年 9 月，在经历了三个月超过美联储 2% 目标两倍的物价上涨之后，美国中央银行的工作人员和政策制定者一改对通胀的消极态度，开始将其描述为 "高涨"。【原文：In September 2021, after absorbing three months of price hikes that were more than double the Federal Reserve's 2% target, U.S. central bank staff and policymakers shifted from their more passive tone about inflation and began describing it as "elevated."】

item.title: 通用、福特利润或因电动汽车需求降温和美国经销商软件故障而受挫
item.description: 通用汽车和福特汽车本周公布的季度业绩可能会导致利润下降，原因是该行业对电动汽车的高风险押注未能获得回报，而经销商使用的重要计算机网络遭到网络攻击，导致销售中断。【原文：General Motors and Ford may post lower profit when they report quarterly results this week, as the industry's high-stakes bet on EVs fails to pay off, while a cyberattack on a crucial computer network used by dealerships disrupted sales.】

item.title: 早间新闻拜登退选、大选押注转移、中国减产
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 没有安全的大宗交易，投资银行家采取行动保障费用
item.description: 随着越来越多的大型交易面临监管机构的挑战，投资银行家们正在改变他们要求获得报酬的方式，以保持并提高他们通过为公司并购提供建议而获得的费用收入。【原文：Investment bankers are changing how they ask to be paid in a bid to preserve and boost fee revenue they generate from advising companies on mergers and acquisitions, as more big deals face challenges by regulators.】

item.title: 阿联酋迪拜航空公司称扩建计划因波音延误而受阻
item.description: 迪拜航空公司周一表示，由于波音公司的飞机交付计划推迟，迪拜航空公司的机队扩张计划受到影响。【原文：Budget carrier flydubai's fleet expansion plans have been hit by delays to Boeing's aircraft delivery schedule, the Dubai airline said on Monday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，大韩航空将订购约 20 架波音 777X 飞机
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，波音公司将于周一宣布向大韩航空订购约20架777X喷气机，这将推动这家美国飞机制造商拖延已久的飞机项目。【原文：Boeing is set to announce on Monday an order for roughly 20 777X jets from Korean Air , in a boost to the U.S. planemaker’s long-delayed plane programme, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 共和党参议员敦促国防公司首席执行官保障精神工作
item.description: 美国参议员杰里-莫兰（Jerry Moran）敦促各大国防公司的首席执行官确保精神航空系统公司的工作不会因波音公司计划收购这家位于堪萨斯州的供应商而中断。【原文：U.S. Senator Jerry Moran is urging the CEOs of major defense companies to ensure that work performed by Spirit AeroSystems will not be disrupted by Boeing's planned acquisition of the Kansas-based supplier.】

item.title: 消息人士称，印度就信实与迪士尼 85 亿美元并购案发出 100 项反垄断质询
item.description: 两位消息人士告诉路透社，印度反垄断机构已经向信实工业公司和华特迪士尼公司提出了大约 100 个问题，这些问题与他们价值 85 亿美元的印度媒体资产合并有关，其中包括体育版权的细节，因为该机构加强了对这一交易的审查。【原文：India's antitrust body has asked Reliance Industries and Walt Disney around 100 questions linked to their $8.5 billion India media assets merger, including details on sports rights as it heightens its scrutiny of the deal, two sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国就 15 万辆 Stellantis 车辆动力损失展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周一表示，已开始对大约 15 万辆 Stellantis 汽车进行初步评估，因为有报告称这些汽车因电气问题而失去动力。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Monday that it has opened a preliminary evaluation into about 150,000 Stellantis vehicles over reports of loss of motive power due to electrical concerns.】

item.title: 拜登退出总统竞选后期货上涨
item.description: 在乔-拜登总统选择退出竞选后，投资者对候选人唐纳德-特朗普在 11 月大选中获胜的可能性进行了评估，美国股指期货周一攀升。【原文：U.S. stock index futures climbed on Monday as investors assessed the chances of a win by candidate Donald Trump in the November elections after President Joe Biden opted out of the race.】

item.title: G20 监督机构称，非银行的脆弱性为 "冲击 "敞开大门
item.description: 二十国集团（G20）风险监督机构周一表示，为提高货币市场基金和其他类型 "非银行 "的安全性而实施的改革进展甚微，导致全球金融体系容易受到更多冲击。【原文：Patchy progress on implementing reforms to make money market funds and other types of "non banks" safer has left the global financial system vulnerable to more shocks, the G20's risk watchdog said on Monday.】

item.title: 中国对其十年政策承诺的承诺面临越来越多的怀疑
item.description: 随着中国经济失衡的加剧，中国政府面临的压力也越来越大，要求它兑现十年前在上周召开的领导层会议上重提的政策承诺，因为近年来它一直未能取得重大突破。【原文：As imbalances in China's economy deepen, pressure is growing on Beijing to deliver on the decade-old policy promises it revived at an agenda-setting leadership meeting last week, having failed to achieve major breakthroughs in recent years.】

item.title: 杜嘉班纳首席执行官准备向新投资者开放资本
item.description: 意大利时装品牌杜嘉班纳首席执行官表示，杜嘉班纳准备考虑通过上市或其他途径向新投资者开放资本。【原文：Dolce&Gabbana is ready to consider opening up its capital to new investors either through a listing or other routes, the Italian fashion house's CEO said.】

item.title: 安普拉茨准备分拆上市，裁员节约成本
item.description: 英美铂金公司（Amplats）周一表示，在计划与母公司分拆之前，该公司已裁员约3700人，以减少开支。【原文：Anglo American Platinum (Amplats) has cut about 3,700 jobs to reduce spending ahead of a planned demerger from its parent company, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称明年石油市场可能过剩
item.description: 摩根士丹利表示，目前原油市场供应紧张，但明年可能会出现过剩，布伦特原油价格将跌至 70 美元中高价位。【原文：The crude oil market is currently tight but next year will likely be in surplus, with Brent prices declining into the mid-to-high $70s range, Morgan Stanley said.】
